lead_paragraph: The blocked law, adopted last April, would ban the most common method used in second-trimester abortions, known as dilation and evacuation.
snippet: The blocked law, adopted last April, would ban the most common method used in second-trimester abortions, known as dilation and evacuation.

headline.main: Kansas Court of Appeals Voids Restrictive 2015 Abortion Law
headline.print_headline: In Kansas, Court Voids State Curbs on Abortion

abstract: Kansas Court of Appeals, by issuing split decision, rules that state Constitution protects woman's right to abortion;  7-7 vote means lower court ruling, which blocked enforcement of 2015 state law banning most common method used in second-trimester abortion, must be upheld; tie among justices indicates issue is likely to be revisited, at state Supreme Court level.
